akn:section.akn:heading: Applicability of Federal and State laws

akn:content.akn:p: § 4422. Applicability of Federal and State laws The payment of any tax imposed by this chapter with respect to any activity shall not exempt any person from any penalty provided by a law of the United States or of any State for engaging in the same activity, nor shall the payment of any such tax prohibit any State from placing a tax on the same activity for State or other purposes. (Aug. 16, 1954, ch. 736, 68A Stat. 528.)
